scholastic has not made it easier to continue book orders. I work in a district where families don't necessarily have bank accounts, credit cards, or computers to place orders online. This is extremely in equitable and you are saying that only families with bank accounts, credit cards, and computers can have access to your books. When asked for an alternative it was a very convoluted task that is actually more work then before. I was told kids can bring in checks and I can print out some form, however the customer representative is still assuming that all of my students' families have access to checking accounts. The fact that you didn't give teachers an option to continue doing it the old way shows that you don't understand the communities you're serving. I am very disappointed. The fact that you didn't give teachers an option to continue doing it the old way shows that you don't understand the communities you're serving. I am very disappointed

Customer service was excellent on my call. I would like to have back the ability to change the due dates (although there could be an additional deadline when all orders are automatically submitted if the teacher has not submitted the order by that date). I would like to receive the monthly catalogs right at the beginning of the month (not mid-month as they have been arriving for me). I also think that we will see a decline in orders if they can only be submitted online.  As a faithful Scholastic customer and Golden Apple teacher, I have always has way more paper orders than online orders. Going online isn't as quick and easy for many busy families. I wanted to know how many bonus points I have because when logging into my account it said 0. Wanted to know where they went. I was told since I don’t have my own class this year, I can’t utilize them. I still work with individuals, and have classroom teacher colleagues who could benefit as well. It is disappointing that the system changed, making parents order online.  The demographic I teach in does not appreciate technology as much as we would like.  In order for my students to order books I have to have them write on paper what they used to mark on the order form or circle it in the flyer.  Then there is the "new" taxing of the order, I end up paying the tax.  I do not like the new system.

Provide a better way  for those families who don’t have internet. This new way is very confusing and makes it more difficult to order. I’m not happy with the new ordering process. After 33 years I probably won’t continue using Scholastic.

I prefer talking on the telephone, instead of composing online while navigating between screens. Prefer to talk in person ... on a phone.

I initially called on 9/6 because, after 13 years of successfully using Scholastic Book Order at my school, my families couldn't connect to me because I was not listed under my school. I spoke with Melissa, who was very nice and she tried to resolve the issue but couldn't. I was told that IT would be contacting me to fix the problem, but I never heard back from them. I called again on Friday, 9/8, but was on hold for a long time and eventually had to hang up because I had to go home. Yesterday, 9/11, I tried the online chat, but was on hold for that so I called as well. Melissa happened to join the chat after several minutes and told me that the problem was fixed. I am glad everything was resolved, but am disappointed that nobody from IT contacted me and I had to seek out information and a resolution. I had to email my families multiple times to try to keep them apprised of the situation and it made me look like I was disorganized and not on top of things.
It was a totally automated encounter. I never communicated with a live representative.

I am very disappointed that Scholastic has gone away from the affordable books of the past!  We really looked forward to sending home the monthly flyers.  Unfortunately I will not be continuing with this practice.

I contacted in regards to only receiving one flyer, went in the past I’ve usually received several to hand out to my students. I asked about the scenes and was given an answer. However, I felt like my concerns over this change wasn’t really taken into consideration, when for the past 10 years, I’ve always had many more flyers to hand out. having a lot of selection for my sister she’s from is it big deal and the ability to get bonus points for books and return in my classroom.

I think that in trying to make it easier for teachers you are actually making it harder.  If you set the due date out a month then that means that I have orders out longer, I have parents asking me where there orders are and since the due date is a month away I don't want to have to keep submitting their orders to make sure they arrive in a timely manner.  When I can set my own due date then I know when the orders go in and I don't have parents waiting a long time to order.  So i am not really happy with this change.  It makes it more of a hassel for me then a help.
Don't know how to use my bonus/Rewards points for items I wanted to get.

I spent several years saving up my bonus points to purchase an Apple technology product for my students to use in the classroom. I finally had enough bonus points saved this year to purchase it and suddenly all of the things I had been saving for were eliminated from the bonus catalog. There is now literally zero incentive for me to waste my time preparing catalogs and urging parents to buy books from scholastic when all of the rewards I actually wanted have been changed. Why was there no warning about this? A lot of my colleagues and I have been talking and we have collectively decided that it is no longer worth our time to help sell Scholastic books. Apple products had been a part of the catalog for the last ten years as I recall and were available as recently as June. What changed? In addition, the September bonus program was changed to only 5X the $ value of your class order instead of the 10,000 points offered as usual. If the goal was to make teachers less likely to spend their valuable time pushing your non-essential products to students and families, you have succeeded. I will not be wasting any more time this year distributing flyers, reminding parents about order deadlines, checking up on back ordered books, or doing any of the extra work required of myself to support your program. I'm not sure who was responsible for the decision but if I am writing to you about it, my guess is it is probably making a lot of other teachers around the country upset too as I don't usually take the time out of my day to complain.  If possible, I would like someone from your company to call me to discuss the reasoning behind this decision and/or possibly how I can go about exchanging my bonus points for actual money to buy one of the recently eliminated products I had been saving up years for. The phone number where I can be reached is 908-361-4050. Thank you.

I am really hoping that they bring back the Judy Newman Book of the Week selections. They are affordable books for teachers who fundraise to purchase books for their students. It is sorely missed this year by teachers all through my district, especially myself!

Unable to change the due date for the book order.  Chat person informed me that it is no longer possible - I am very frustrated with this new plan.

I am a teacher and a family placed an order.  I received an email that they paid and I need to submit my cart on my class page.  When I log in, there is no order.  The customer service rep said they need to resubmit but, again, they paid. The rep could not find anything on the account and was unaware of the order process.

I have been a loyal customer of Scholastic for many years.  I am extremely disappointed by the changes made for this school year.  I have always been Scholastic's biggest cheerleader and have helped many teachers at my school find book sponsors for each of the kids in their class.  These sponsors donate money each year so students can receive a book to keep each month.  The joy on the kids faces when they get these books is second to none.  Unfortunately, due to your steep price increases we are no longer able to do this.  In the past you have always offered a wide variety of high quality literature often times at the $1 and $2 price points.  This year you only offer one book at a $2 price point and none at $1.  There are also very few books under $5 that are grade appropriate.  The $2 book each month is not always at an interest level of each grade level so this is not an option.  We as a school are so disappointed after trying to figure out how we can make the book sponsors donations work that we are considering partnering with organizations other than scholastic to make this happen.    I am also very disappointed that you got rid of the birthday book coupon option.  This is something many of us teachers have purchased for years and our kids look forward to choosing a book that they get for free.  I am assuming this was discontinued due to the lack of books under $5 as compared to the past.  Scholastic has fallen severely short of their goals of giving ALL students access to quality literature at a reasonable price.  The effect is that kids will not get to experience the love and joy of reading that they have in the past because the books are inaccessible to them.  I encourage you to relook at your values and mission and go back to the quality service you've provided in the past.

I've used Scholastic for over 30 years. The last few years service has been rough. With COVID interruptions in service was understandable. Now, things are not as smooth. It's September 11 and I haven't received any Scholastic flyers for this year, yet. Thanks to your chat service I was reassured that the flyers should arrive this week. Thank you.

Person was helpful. I just got my first catalogs. Absolutely hate them. Where are the checkout boxes on the back. Way too few selections. How about more book choices and less graphic novels and real reading materials. I have to say you’re probably losing us as a customer. The quality continues to go downhill.
The rep was knowledgeable and answered my questions.  I just was not happy with the changes made to book clubs.

Honestly I appreciate the kindness of the rep but I still can't understand why I can't purchase a Scholastic book on book club site?  I am not even asking to use points but just can't understand how a Scholastic book is only available on the Scholastic Teacher site.

I think representatives should end over the FAQs. I did, and did not have the experience that was described in the FAQ. Very disappointed, the representative was short and rude. It was 8 in the morning, the beginning of the day. I can only imagine what it would be like at the end of the day.
My concern was acknowledged, however there is still no resolution as it would require a procedural change on your part.

Many of my poor, rural families don't have internet or smartphones. They need to be able to send in checks. It is unprofessional and inappropriate to ask teachers to take on this burden. I will not be ordering anything nor will I pass out flyers until this is resolved. If you check my history, I spend hundreds of dollars every year on your books. I'll be taking that money elsewhere from now on. I will also be telling every teacher I know in person and on all of my social media teacher groups that your company does not care for underprivileged children and that they should no longer do business with you.  I have been a loyal customer for 24 years. This situation saddens and infuriates me.

September 8th customer service was great!  However, I contacted Scholastic on August 16th to find out where my fliers were as all of my colleagues received their copies.  I was told I would get them after Sept 11th.  It appears that information was incorrect.  I really hope I receive the September flier in time with all of the extra bonus points.

Basically, I have been a First Grade teacher at Eduprize Schools for three years.  Back in May I asked on the online chat if I could transfer my account and bonus points.  I told the gal that I was opening my own preschool and had an LLC.  She said it was not a problem.  However, then there were issues trying to get my bonus points, so I was told to just open a new account.  I did this and then I asked for magazines to be sent because my parents are asking for them.  They never came, so I chatted again and got different info.  Now they say I need to be a verified school, which i can understand, however if people order books aren't you making money?  I literally have 8 parents asking me for the book orders, that I did not know what going to be so hard to get.  I owned a peschoool 20 years ago and had no issues getting book orders sent,,and was even a part of the Clifford Scholastic Weekly Reader.  I am a great customer and am sad it is such an ordeal to get books into the hands of my families and in my classroom. Thank you for any help!

Scholastic always sends their take home flyers early.  I can always send them home the first day of school. They were never sent out.  Customer service representative said it’s because I live in NJ so they’re sending them later.  That’s ridiculous.  They should have been ready for the first day of school. Staggering their arrival is pointless.  I wanted them before students came.  So I had to call to get them sent.  So incredibly frustrating.
I would like to see the teacher store connected to the book club store. It’s so much easier to do one order and one shipping fee.
Thank you for supporting Book Trust.  My students and I appreciate it!

It would be helpful to make sure credits are showing up on my Teacher page.

I have had a problem getting my book club flyers since Covid.  I can not tell you how many times I have had to contact customer service to send them to me. Please improve your book club service by getting the flyers to the teachers before the month begins so that a timely order can be placed.

I still felt a bit confused after my conversation so a bit more details would have been helpful and then just a day later I received an email from your company telling me I “only needed to register” so that confused me more and I had to reply to the email and ask if I was registered!!!
No Comments

Scholastic has taken away the ability for teachers to set their own order due date, which is inevitably going to result in fewer orders. I've been using Scholastic for 22 years, so I'm not a fan of this and some  of the other recent changes. I ALWAYS get the most parent orders when I give families 1-2 weeks to order. If the due date is too far out, they forget about it. I also had to figure out myself that paper catalogs are only coming if I order them myself, so I didn't have them ready to send home with famlies the first week (which always results in the most orders). I'm also not excited about not being able to earn as many bonus points. And I cant even keep up with your website changes-- every year and it never seems to get better. Sorry! I want to love Scholastic, but you guys are not making this easier for this veteran teacher or incentivizing me to get families to order.  The customer service person who responded to my inital message was prompt and professional- my negative reviews have nothing to do with them. I'm just uphappy with corporate changes.  Thank you for your time.

Truly listen to the concerns of educators rather than telling us all the improvements. Listen to the concerns about prices rather than letting us know the books are higher quality. Once I explained that I already located the books and was still disappointed in the selection, the representative seemed to better understand my concerns. Please just listen to teachers and find ways to offer more books we can afford.

For at least hte past twenty years of teaching, I have been purchasing the birthday coupon books from Scholastic.  The past several years, I have raised funds for my classroom to purchase enough coupon books so every student in my classroom can pick out a book of their own up to $5.00 every month of the school, plus a bonus book during their birthday month.  After raising over $400 to purchase coupon books to do this once again, I was told by the Scholastic helper via help/chat, that Scholastic no longer offered the birthday coupon books.   With inflation, I was counting on an increase in price for the coupon books, or perhaps every a reduction in the amount of coupons, maybe from 30 to 25.   Last year I believe the books were 30 coupons for $49.99.  I was shocked when I was told Scholastic no longer offered the coupon books.  Here I was ready to place my first September order of over $400 (PLUS an additional familiy/student September order would come later this month), and instead I am sending no orders home this month.  The Scholastic chat helper said that they increased the number of $2 and $3 books available for purchase for students, but that's not even close to the number of books a student can choose with a coupon good for up to $5.00.  And being able to choose their own book is a powerful thing for students, and that power of choice is what helps fuel their interest/love of reading.  In the current 2nd & 3rd grade back to school offerings, there are only three books $3 and under, while offerings for twelve books $5 and under.  I felt the chat helper was overstating the effort by Scholastic when touting their increased offerings of $2 and $3 books.     Another thing the chat helper mentioned was the Book Trust program, and how they felt that could be the solution to my dilemma.   What the chat helper was not aware of though, is that the window for applications to the Book Trust program for 2023 - 2024 has already closed.  I signed to be considered for the 2024 - 2025 program, even though I cna't sign up as an individual teacher, you sign up as a school, and the school is expected to contribute funds for the books, which I consider highly unlikey with current budgets.  So I felt the Scholastic chat helper really didn't fully understand how the Book Trust program works, but rather was looking at their cue sheet to say "this" when a disgruntled custonmer says "that."    So now I'm left with very limited options for how to spend the $400+ I raised for this school year.  I could pick out a $2 book for each student over the next 9 months, a book they may or may not like, or may or may not be at their reading level.  Or maybe I just have them pick out a book of their choice for one or two months out of the year.  Maybe just have student recommend books that could be purchased for our classorom library.   Neither of those options seems very enticing to me.  Not only do I now have to decide WHAT to do with the money I have raised, if the coupon books are not going to be offered int he future, I doubt I will have future fundraisers to purchase Scholastic books for my students.  So here I am, a Scholasti Gold Apple Teacher, who had a plan going into the school, that has now been scuttled, without any really appealing alternatives at the moment.  It saddens me that for the first time in over twenty years, September Scholastic book orders have not gone home to families, and for the first time in several years, my students won't be picking out free books this month.
Customer service reps are always helpful and kind!!!!!!!! I appreciate all you do to support schools and offer affordable books for my students!

I am very disappointed that there are not better value deals for teachers, parents and students.  In the past, at the beginning of the year and actually, throughout the entire year, I have been able to find bundles for books where they are 25/$25 for example.  It's a great way to begin the school year.  It is hard to find deals where the books are even $2.  As a reading specialist, I have sponsors that donate money so that my below average, reluctant and economically challenged students are able to receive a free book every month of the school year.  This promotes so much literacy in the homes.  I am also part of a reading organization Lewis and Clark Reading Council.  We do an annual service project called Books for Babies.  We buy books with a bookmark for new families with newborns and donate to either regional hospitals or pediatrician offices.  With the price increase and lack of value bundles, I may not be able to utilize Scholastic the way I have in the past.  Which means, I am going to need to search for a more economical solution.
